definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: Beth kept on, with only slight relapses into idleness or grieving.
sentences.chinese: 只有貝思堅持不懈，極少躲懶或悲天憫人。

sentences.english: Because of his long-term unremitting efforts, he finally won his the laurel of "The Sage of Calligraphy".
sentences.chinese: 長期堅持不懈的努力，終於使他贏得“書聖”的桂冠。

sentences.english: The successful launch was a testament to the value of perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 這次成功的發射證明了堅持不懈是多麼可貴。

sentences.english: Make sure you capture these attributes for your use cases diligently.
sentences.chinese: 請確定你在堅持不懈地爲你的用例捕獲這些屬性。

sentences.english: But through good and evil I stuck to my books.
sentences.chinese: 不過，好也罷歹也罷，讀書我倒是堅持不懈。

sentences.english: By my remorseless great efforts, i met him finally.
sentences.chinese: 經過我堅持不懈的努力，我終於認識了他。

sentences.english: Pursue your object be it what it will steadily and indefatigably.
sentences.chinese: 不管追求什麼目標，都迎堅持不懈。

sentences.english: The need for more consistent application and conduct of Pre-Dive Safety Meetings.
sentences.chinese: 潛水前安全會議的進一步堅持不懈的必要性。

sentences.english: We all admire their persistant efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我們都很欽佩他們堅持不懈的努力。

sentences.english: This job should catch after all, unremittingly.
sentences.chinese: 這項工作要一抓到底，堅持不懈。

sentences.english: Huatai adheres to seeking zero-defect quality unremittingly.
sentences.chinese: 華泰公司堅持不懈的追求品質零缺陷。

sentences.english: The beginner must practice constantly, aiming chops and jabs at an imaginary partner.
sentences.chinese: 初學者必需堅持不懈的練習，瞄準假想對手不斷猛擊。

sentences.english: Success is mostly just hanging on after others have let go!
sentences.chinese: 成功者往往是在別人放棄後仍然堅持不懈。

sentences.english: Persisent people begin their success where others end in failure.
sentences.chinese: 在他人以失敗告終的地方，堅持不懈者開始其成功。

sentences.english: If you keep trying you will succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你堅持不懈，最終將成功。

sentences.english: We must develop the advanced productive forces without letup.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須堅持不懈地發展先進的生產力。

definition: practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
to develop/to make full use of
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
